formatting_defaults.description: These attributes are used to format the filename when no information is available, and can generally be set to whatever you'd like.

dry.description: When True, the program will perform a dry run and not make any changes to the system or file structure. Defaults to False.

options.True: Perform a dry run and display hypothetical changes.
options.False: Perform the operation and save changes to the system or file structure.

error_msg.description: This is the error message that will be displayed if there is an issue with the program. Variables can be set within {} such as {error}.
error_msg.options: Any string you'd like to show as an error message.

filename.description: This is the default filename for the JSON file used during dataset creation.

formatter.description: This is the formatter used to format the filename. There are two options: 'standard' and 'youtube'.

options.standard: This formatter will format the filename using artist, title, features and misc as data settings.
options.youtube: This formatter will format the filename using artist, title, features, misc and youtube_id as data settings.

directory.description: This is the default directory where files will be saved, searched for, etc.

exts.description: This is a list of valid file extensions that the program will accept.
exts.options: A comma-separated list of file extensions.
